key_points: Stimulus check payments under the American Rescue Plan end with 2021.
$1,400 payments were sent to most Americans, with expanded Child Tax Credit benefits.
No more monthly child tax credit payments are planned for 2022.
"Plus-up" payments are being sent to some families based on changes noted in their 2020 tax filings.
Changes triggering "plus-up" payments include lower income or having a child.
Economic Impact Payments are available for individuals making $75,000 or less, or married couples making $150,000 or less.
The IRS will send out "plus-up" payments until December 31, based on the legislative deadline.
Democrats plan to continue efforts to extend the Child Tax Credit payments into 2022.
A one-year extension of the Child Tax Credit would cost $185 billion.
Extending the Child Tax Credit for 10 years would cost $1.6 trillion.
